full_summary:
**Request for Standing Offer for Environmental Services**
=============================================

The Government of Canada, represented by Natural Resources Canada (NRCan), invites qualified contractors to submit a Request for Standing Offer for environmental services.

**Project Context**
-----------------

NRCan requires environmental services for various projects at its sites across Canada on an “as and when required basis.” The services cover nine (9) streams, including:

* Environmental Site Assessment
* Fuel Storage Tank Management
* Management of Halocarbon Containing Equipment
* Wastewater Management
* Solid Non-Hazardous Waste Management
* Hazardous Materials Management
* Air Contaminant Emissions Studies
* Building Asbestos Management
* Legionella Management

**Locations**
------------

Potential project locations may include, but are not limited to:

* Pacific Forestry Center, Victoria, BC
* Northern Forestry Center, Edmonton, AB
* Canmet ENERGY Research Centre, Devon, AB
* Geological Survey of Canada, Calgary, AB
* Prince Albert Satellite Station, Prince Albert, SK
* Great Lakes Forestry Center, Sault Ste Marie, ON
* Canmet MATERIALS, Hamilton, ON
* Bells Corners Complex and Booth Street Complex, Ottawa, ON
* Canmet ENERGY Research Centre, Varennes, QC
* Laurentian Forestry Center, Québec, QC
* Atlantic Forestry Center, Fredericton, NB

**Preferred Contractors**
----------------------

NRCan intends to award up to two (2) Standing Offers in each region for each stream:

* Atlantic (NB, NS, NL)
* Quebec
* Ontario (not including the National Capital Region)
* National Capital Region (NCR)
* British Columbia & Alberta
* Saskatchewan & Manitoba

**Contract Duration**
------------------

The period of the Standing Offer shall be for two (2) years with the option to extend the period of the Standing Offer for up to three (3) additional one-year periods.

**Security Requirements**
----------------------

Security requirements are associated with this requirement.

**Contract Award**
-----------------

The contract award criteria will be based on the evaluation of the technical, commercial and sustainability aspects as outlined in the solicitation documents.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For more information, please contact Ian Taylor at [ian.taylor@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca](mailto:ian.taylor@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)

[Deadline]**Tender Closing Date**: February 21, 2023, 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time.**
